metadata.title: CVE-2022-2469 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
GNU SASL libgsasl server-side read-out-of-bounds with maliciousauthenticated GSS-API client

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2469` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gsasl - 1.10.0-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
gsasl-common - 1.10.0-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
libgsasl7 - 1.10.0-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gsasl package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.0-5ubuntu0.1~esm1').
